lines.text: We have a very important school report on turquoise jewelry due in two days, and we can't find any books on it, and the President's having us followed. It's too much pressure.
Checkers - shut up. Or I'll feed you to the Chinese.
You kicked Checkers, you're prejudiced and you have a potty mouth.
I've got a way with young people. They trust me.
Every lie is another brick in the pathway to hell.
Checkers pooped.
Girls, the President's dog doesn't "poop." He "does his business."
Excuse me, Mr. President. I was not informed that you were in the middle of... what the hell ARE you in the middle of?
I love Dick!
Dick frightens me!

[meeting Betsy and Arlene]
You're Deep Throat?
Yeah, we both are.
How old are you?
Twenty-three.
Is that your combined ages?

[scoffs]
There's no need to be snotty.

Because of your thoughtlessness, we've missed the field trip lunch at McDonald's - which the students on the other buses are now enjoying. We will return to school, for a *cold* lunch. In the cafeteria.
I have met yams with more going on upstairs than these two.
War is not healthy for children and other living things.
How dare those people treat us like we're stupid teenage girls.
We are stupid teenage girls.
No. We're human beings, and we're American citizens. And four score and seven years ago our forefathers... did something.

[shouting]
You can't let dick control your life.
It's called incest Arlene, and it's against the law
So you really think that my dad could be alive?

Alive and famous! It makes perfect sense, he was probably married or something and your mom had to keep it a secret to protect his reputation. I mean, he's probably out there right now, his heart breaking because he can't reach out to the one person who truly maters to him. His darling daughter.
My life is so tragic!
Or it could be worse! What if... years from now you get married and find out that your finacee's dad is your dad, too, and you two are brother and sister!
Oh my GOD!
Mhm. It's called incest, Arlene. And it's against the law.
You're the smartest person I know.
But you don't know anybody...
It's alright, gentlemen. I'm familiar with these two young ladies. Well, not "familiar", familiar, obviously.
I'll take responsibility here. I'll be the only person in this administration who's willing to take responsibility for anything.
What are you doing?
Beer Bong?
I'm definitely tripping already... heavily.
You suck, Dick!
Pat, will ya stop snoring, goddamn it! My head is about to explode!
Hey, that guy has T.P. stuck to his shoe.
Hey, mister! Hey! Hey, you, hey turn around, mister!
Young lady, I am a VERY busy man.
Wait a minute, I know you.
Me too. But from where?
[thinks for a second, then gasps]
Are you the guy who sells corndogs at the mall?
Isn't it against the law to cut up the flag?
Not if you sew it back together.

[while looking at a portrait of George Washington]
It looks like he's wearing blush.
[the girls giggle]
Are you the President's dog trainer?
I'm John Dean, Chief White House Counsel.
Oh. That's too bad.
We think you haven't been completely honest with us.
Let me tell you, if it's about that goddamn Watergate! I tell you, I had NOTHING to do with it, you hear? It's those goddamn Woodward and Burnstein! They're out to get me!

[Stunned silence]
Actually it was just about the dog.
You act like you like him. But we don't think you do.
What dog?
